The 2025 NCAA football regular season has come to an end and the first round of college football playoff games are here. As we enter into week 17, there are plenty of hard-hitting matchups to tune into this week, including Oklahoma vs. Alabama, Texas A&M vs. Miami, Ole Miss vs. Tulane and Oregon vs. James Madison. title: ASCAP Faces $123M Lawsuit Over Stock Music On News & Sports Radio: â€˜Financially Devastatingâ€™
summary: The case claims production music owners are paid only a fraction of the royalties they're owed. ASCAP calls the accusations "baseless."
body: ASCAP is facing a lawsuit claiming it â€œseverely underpaysâ€ for so-called production music used by talk and sports radio stations, wrongfully withholding more than $120 million in royalties from their rightful owners. The case claims ASCAPâ€™s policies pay out royalties for only a fraction of the actual performances of such songs (also known as stock or library music), which often play on news, talk or sports radio programs as background music or during segment transitions. Related Production Libraries Are Licensing to AI Companies. Could It Threaten Their Whole Business? Hot 97's 'Ebro in the Morning' Show Is 'Over' After 13 Years Universal Music Group Opens UMusic Shops In New York, London Filed by Alibi Music and several other production music publishers, the lawsuit claims ASCAP is wrongfully diverting more than $15 million per year, totaling more than â€œ$123 million in misallocated royaltiesâ€ over eight years â€” a hit thatâ€™s been â€œfinancially devastatingâ€ for publishers and composers. â€œASCAP intentionally deprives [production] music owners and publishers of valuable performance royalties,â€ writes veteran music attorney Richard Busch , who represents tâ€¦

title: Hamilton docked nine more points after rule breach
summary: Hamilton Academical are given an additional nine-point deduction following an Scottish Professional Football League disciplinary tribunal.

title: Green becomes most expensive overseas IPL player
summary: Kolkata Knight Riders sign Australia all-rounder Cameron Green for 25.2 crore (Â£2.1m) for next year's Indian Premier League.

summary: Paris St-Germain and France forward Ousmane Dembele is named the men's player of the year at the Fifa Best awards.

summary: Barcelona midfielder Aitana Bonmati is the women's player of the year at the Fifa Best Awards for the third year in a row, with England's Sarina Wiegman named coach of the year.

title: 'Car crash' - boxing reacts to Paul v Joshua announcement
summary: Eddie Hearn, Tony Bellew, Moses Itauma and more react to the news that Jake Paul will fight former heavyweight world champion Anthony Joshua in Miami, Florida.

title: Nancy 'grateful' for Celtic backing amid losing start
summary: Wilfried Nancy says "I don't have to prove anything to anybody" amid criticism of his losing start as Celtic manager.

title: PSG ordered to pay Mbappe 60m euros
summary: Paris St-Germain are ordered to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60m euros (Â£52.5m) in unpaid salary and bonuses by a French court.

title: Liverpool parade attacker jailed for 21 years and six months
summary: The married father of three is sentenced after driving at crowds "in a rage" at the victory parade.

title: Fernandes 'hurt' that Man Utd 'wanted him to go' to Saudi
summary: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes says it "hurt" to realise the club "wanted me to leave" when Saudi Arabia's Al-Hilal proposed a huge offer in the summer.

title: Former South Africa captain Dumke dies aged 29
summary: Former South Africa women's captain Lusanda Dumke dies after being diagnosed with a rare gastric cancer.

title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
summary: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

title: 'Fight, determination and grit' - Stokes' team orders
summary: England Test captain Ben Stokes tells BBC Sport's Jonathan Agnew that he has "used my voice more than I have at any time in the past three and a half years" going into the must-win third Ashes Test against Australia in Adelaide.

title: Rodgers named new boss of Saudi side
summary: Brendan Rodgers is the new manager of Saudi club Al-Qadsiah after leaving Celtic in October.

title: Gloucester confirm exit of Wales scrum-half Williams

title: Erratic Newcastle give Howe 'horrible feeling'

title: Portuguese GP to return to F1 calendar in 2027
summary: Portugal will return to the F1 calendar in 2027 and 2028, with a race held at the Algarve International Circuit near Portimao.
